words.definition: An assumption is something that you believe is true but cannot prove.
words.example: I went to the cafeteria on the assumption that everyone would be there.

words.definition: Barley is a grain that is used for animal feed, health food and beer.
words.example: The farmer grew barley to feed his cows in the winter.

words.definition: A beast is a large, dangerous animal.
words.example: A lion is one of the fiercest beasts on Earth.

words.definition: A colonel is a military officer.
words.example: James has been given a promotion in the army. He is now a colonel.

words.definition: If a disease is contagious, it is easily carried from one person to another.
words.example: You must wear protective clothing because the patient’s illness is contagious.

words.definition: A corpse is a dead body of a human.
words.example: After the accident, the corpse was taken to the hospital.

words.definition: A crisis is a situation that is extremely stressful or dangerous.
words.example: The bank’s crisis caused many people to lose their money.

words.definition: To cure means to cause an illness or injury to end or disappear.
words.example: The wizard cured the king’s illness with a magic potion.

words.definition: If something is deformed, it is not shaped the way it should be.
words.example: The tree was deformed because it grew in a very windy area.

words.definition: To discriminate means to judge people based on their race, religion, or sex.
words.example: It is wrong to discriminate against people because of their looks.

words.definition: An embassy is where government officials work in a foreign country.
words.example: We went to the embassy to get a visa for our trip.

words.definition: To extinguish a fire means to make it stop burning.
words.example: The firefighters worked hard to extinguish the blaze.

words.definition: Flint is a hard stone that people used to make sparks for a fire.
words.example: In ancient times, people used flint to start fires.

words.definition: To harass someone is to bother or annoy them repeatedly.
words.example: The bully harassed the smaller boy during every recess.

words.definition: To integrate means to join or combine things to form a whole.
words.example: The goal was to integrate the new students into the class.

words.definition: If something is miniature, it is very small.
words.example: The boy has a collection of miniature cars.

words.definition: Nutrition is the process by which people or animals take in food.
words.example: Good nutrition is essential for a healthy body.

words.definition: If something happens promptly, it happens right away or quickly.
words.example: The waiter arrived promptly with our drinks.

words.definition: A technician is someone who is skilled in a particular technical area.
words.example: The technician fixed my computer in less than an hour.

words.definition: The tropics are the areas around the Earth's equator.
words.example: Many colorful birds live in the tropics.
